    • Constructor Detail

      • Service

        public Service(File settingsFile)
        throws Exception
        Event Service Constructor. Accepts File Object Containing network and settings Configuration file.
        Parameters:
        settingsFile - File Object pointing to the "BlockChainSettings.json" Configuration file.
        Throws:
        Exception - if failed to load configurations. It's important to read documentation befor set Configuration file values.

      • Service

        public Service(String strSettingsPath)
        throws Exception
        Smart Contract event Service Constructor. Accepts String referencing to network and settings Configuration file absolute path.
        Parameters:
        strSettingsPath - Sting pointing to the "BlockChainSettings.json" absolute Configuration file path.
        Throws:
        Exception - if failed to load configurations. It's important to read documentation befor set Configuration file values.

      • Service

        public Service()
        throws Exception
        Smart Contract Event Service Contructor. Loads netwotk and settings BlockChain Configurations as default resource library file.
        Throws:
        Exception - if failed to load configurations. It's important to read documentation befor set Configuration file values.

    • Method Detail

      • setUserCredencials

        public void setUserCredencials(String nickName,
                               String password,
                               File certificateFile)
                        throws Exception
        Verifies identity of User Credentials.
        Parameters:
        nickName - User nickName previously registered in BlockChain network.
        password - User password/secret.
        certificateFile - File Object pointing to the .cert file that contains the String with User Certificate.
        Throws:
        Exception, - LoginException if the network denies acces to the user.
        Exception

      • setUserCredencials

        public void setUserCredencials(String nickName,
                               String password,
                               String certificate)
                        throws Exception
        Verifies identity of User Credentials.
        Parameters:
        nickName - User nickName previously registered in BlockChain network.
        password - User password/secret.
        certificate - String User Certificate.
        Throws:
        Exception, - LoginException if the network denies acces to the user.
        Exception

      • createContractFromBytes

        public void createContractFromBytes(String contractName,
                                    byte[] contractBytes)
                             throws katun.smartcontract.manager.exceptions.KatunServiceException
        Event that allows to create and deploy Smart Contracts in BlockChain Katun. It's necessary to use setUserCredencials before run this method.
        Generates an Internal JsonObjectBuilder with event result accesed by getServiceResult() as a JsonObjet.
        It's necessary to use setUserCredencials before run this method.
        Parameters:
        contractName - Name of Smart Contract. Following Java Standard's it's necessary that contract name be the same as the class with .java extension (i.e contractName.java)
        contractBytes - Array of bytes containing the java Smart Contract Code.
        Throws:
        katun.smartcontract.manager.exceptions.KatunServiceException - If user credencials are not previously set or an network connection problem occurs.
        See Also:
        getServiceResult(), setUserCredencials(String nickName, String password, File certificateFile), setUserCredencials(String nickName, String password, String certificate)

      • queryContractByToken

        public void queryContractByToken(String strToken)
        Event that allows to query Smart Contract and Message transactions on BlockChain Katun Network.
        Generates an Internal JsonObjectBuilder with event result accesed by getServiceResult() as a JsonObjet.
        It's necessary to use setUserCredencials before run this method.
        Parameters:
        strToken - String with Transaction ID to be searched in BlockChain Katun network.
        See Also:
        getServiceResult(), setUserCredencials(String nickName, String password, File certificateFile), setUserCredencials(String nickName, String password, String certificate)

      • invokeContractByTokenParsing

        public void invokeContractByTokenParsing(String strToken,
                                         String contractName,
                                         String content,
                                         String invocationString,
                                         String contractStatus)
        Event that allows invoke/execute Smart Contract from previous Smart Contract creation
        using its information obtained querying transaction with queryContractByToken getServiceResult() method's JsonObjet information as parameters.
        It's necessary to use setUserCredencials before run this method.
        Parameters:
        strToken - Hash/Token of previous Smart Contract deployed in BlockChain Katun.
        contractName - Contract name without extension.
        content - Java code Smart Contract content.
        invocationString - String with the nomenclature of the smart contract methods/functions to be invoked following an structured syntax.
        contractStatus - Smart Contract status, only are executed those with deployed status.
        See Also:
        queryContractByToken(String strToken), getServiceResult(), setUserCredencials(String nickName, String password, File certificateFile), setUserCredencials(String nickName, String password, String certificate)

      • createContractInvoking

        public void createContractInvoking(String codeString,
                                   String invString)
        Event that allows to create a Smart Contract using Java standard code, and InvocationString.
        Generates an Internal JsonObjectBuilder with event result accesed by getServiceResult() as a JsonObjet.
        It's necessary to use setUserCredencials before run this method.
        Parameters:
        codeString - Java code. It´s strictly necessary to define class as public
        invString - String with the nomenclature of the smart contract methods/functions to be invoked/executed following an structured syntax.
        See Also:
        validateInvocationString(String functionString), getServiceResult(), setUserCredencials(String nickName, String password, File certificateFile), setUserCredencials(String nickName, String password, String certificate)

      • sendKatunMessage

        public void sendKatunMessage(String senderHash,
                             String receiverHash,
                             String message)
        Event that allows to inject information directly to the BlockChain Katun, using sender (Hash or ID), receiver (Hash or ID) and the information or message to be injected.
        Generates an Internal JsonObjectBuilder with event result accesed by getServiceResult() as a JsonObjet.
        It's necessary to use setUserCredencials before run this method.
        Parameters:
        senderHash - Sender information, Hash or ID prefferently
        receiverHash - Receiver information, Hash or ID prefferently
        message - Message or information to be injected to the BlockChain Katun
        See Also:
        getServiceResult(), setUserCredencials(String nickName, String password, File certificateFile), setUserCredencials(String nickName, String password, String certificate)

      • scheduleContract

        public void scheduleContract(String executionDate,
                             String codeString,
                             String invocationString)
        Event that allows to Schedule a Smart Contract using Java standard code, and InvocationString.
        Generates an Internal JsonObjectBuilder with event result accesed by getServiceResult() as a JsonObjet.
        In this particular the event generates a Service Resut Json Object similar as the following 
         {
 "ContractToken":"Smart Contract's Token deployed",
 "ContractMessage":"Deployment message result [SUCCES/ERROR]",
 "ResType":"SUCCESS",
 "ResToken":"CRON sha256 sign to verify Smart Contract information to be executed.",
 "ResMessage":"[SUCCESS/ERROR]"
 }

        It's necessary to use setUserCredencials before run this method.
        Parameters:
        executionDate - String with Date of Smart Contract execution in "dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm:ss" format.
        codeString - Java code. It´s strictly necessary to define class as public
        invocationString - String with the nomenclature of the smart contract methods/functions to be invoked/executed following an structured syntax.
        See Also:
        validateInvocationString(String functionString), readCronFileInformation(String arg), getServiceResult(), setUserCredencials(String nickName, String password, File certificateFile), setUserCredencials(String nickName, String password, String certificate)

      • validateInvocationString

        public void validateInvocationString(String functionString)
        Function that validates the String with the nomenclature of the smart contract methods/functions
        to be invoked/executed following a structured syntax.
        Validates datatypes supported and value convertions if the invocation String cointains arguments. 
         If the java code is as this example:
 
 public class test{
        int sum(int a, int b){
                return a+b;
        }
        String message(){
                return "this is a test";
 }

        The Invocation String must be: 
         
 function:sum:
 arg:integer:{10}:
 arg:integer:{10}:
 function:message:
        Generates an Internal JsonObjectBuilder with event result accesed by getServiceResult() as a JsonObjet.
        Parameters:
        functionString -
        See Also:
        getServiceResult()

      • getServiceResult

        public javax.json.JsonObject getServiceResult()
        In case of Smart Contracts execution, creation, querying and information injection. A JSON can be built as follows: 
         {"ResToken":"Hash as a Result of the event.",
 "ResType":"[SUCCESS|ERROR/WARNING]", //in case of Event result.
 "ResMessage":"Result message of the event",
 "ContractTx":"Smart Contract HASH/TOKEN identifier.",
 "ContractName":"Contract name without extension",
 "Content":"Standard java code",
 "user":"User nickname who triggers the event",
 "status":"contract status",
 "version":contract version,
 "compilationMessages":Message compilation",
 "ObjType":"[Contract[OK]|KatunObject[OK]|SchedContract[OK]|KatunMessage[OK]"} //depending on Contract type.

        Returns:
        JsonObject with Tx Information.

      • readCronFileInformation

        public String readCronFileInformation(String arg)
        This function allows to read Scheduled Contract information status supplying the CRON sing/ID. It's necessary to use setUserCredencials before run this method.
        Parameters:
        arg - SHA256 CRON sign/ID
        Returns:
        String with information of CRON execution:
        Information obtained if the CRON is not executed yet. 
         Smart Contract HASH/TOKEN identifier.
 Execution date in format dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm:ss

        Information obtained if the CRON is already executed. 
         Smart Contract HASH/TOKEN identifier.
 Execution date in format dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm:ss
 Message with result with TxID of the KatunObject if execution succeded. Else with error details.
        See Also:
        setUserCredencials(String nickName, String password, File certificateFile), setUserCredencials(String nickName, String password, String certificate)
